Name: Requiring the police department to report on all criminal complaints and arrests.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on all criminal complaints and arrests

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety

Summary: This bill would require the New York City Police Department (“NYPD”) to report data on all criminal complaints and arrests. Such data would include a listing of all criminal complaints reported to the NYPD, and information regarding each such complaint, including an indication of whether an arrest for the underlying complaint has occurred.

\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\sl480\slmult1\qj\expndtw0\tab Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 14 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 14-199 to read as follows:\par
\tab\ul\'a7 14-199 Reports on criminal complaints and arrests. a. Data. The commissioner shall post on the department\rquote s website, in machine-readable format, data on all criminal complaints and arrests. \cf1 Such data shall include \cf0 a listing of each criminal complaint received on or after January 1, 2007, and for each such complaint the following information: \par
\ulnone\tab\ul 1. A randomly generated unique identification number; \par
\ulnone\tab\ul 2. The precinct in which the incident occurred;\par
\ulnone\tab\ul 3. The date and time at which the incident occurred; \par
\ulnone\tab\ul 4. A description of the incident and classification of any relevant offenses, including reference to all penal law violations that occurred; \par
\ulnone\tab\ul 5. The date on which the incident was reported to police;\par
\ulnone\tab\ul 6. The suspect\rquote s age, race, and gender, where known; \par
\ulnone\tab\ul 7. The victim\rquote s age, race, and gender, where known; \par
\ulnone\tab\ul 8. The location where the incident occurred, including latitude and longitude if available, but in all cases at least as specific as the nearest intersection; \par
\ulnone\tab\ul 9. Whether the complaint has resulted in an arrest, or otherwise been resolved by the department; \par
\ulnone\tab\ul 10. The date on which any arrest or departmental resolution of a case occurred; and \par
\ulnone\tab\ul 11. If an arrest has occurred, the location of such arrest and the age, race, and gender of each arrestee. \par
\ulnone\tab\ul b. Website. The information required to be reported by subdivision a of this section must remain posted on the department\rquote s website indefinitely, and shall be updated on a quarterly basis with all new criminal complaints and any new arrest information.   \par
\ulnone\tab\'a7 2. \expndtw-3 This local law takes effect immediately.\par
